ygData.subject: RE: Newbie questions
ygData.msgSnippet: Yep I have encountered this.  Generally the people who do this have significantly more down time than I do (mine is nearly zero) so I usually just wander off
ygData.messageBody:
Yep I have encountered this. Generally the people who do this have
significantly more down time than I do (mine is nearly zero) so I usually
just wander off to somewhere else immediately. I can then come back a
little later and voila!, the whole camp is there again and the guy looking
for the choice mob is staring at it and its buddies. I then lament the
others, kill the choice mob and start to wander off again. They quickly get
the point generally and ask me to stick around and help them but agree to
give me first choice on any mob that spawns. The few people I have run into
who don't have the sense to do this when they otherwise could not "break"
the spawn I usually just leave to their fate and move on. I imagine this
will get worse though as I go up in levels.

Kitasi

-----Original Message-----
From: kim@... [mailto:kim@...]
Sent: Wednesday, October 27, 1999 9:52 AM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Newbie questions


From: <kim@...>

On Wed, 27 Oct 1999, Kimes, Dean W. wrote:
>
> Lament is the best song you get other than Selo's until you are 11th
level.
> It will allow you to easily solo critters characters 5 levels higher than
> you just look at because they can't take 3 at once. It allowed me to sol
at
> the bandit camp in Lesser Faydark 4 levels before anyone else I ever saw
> there. No one else could handle the multiple spawns they would have to
> face, but I could easily pull one out at a time and make boocou plat off
the

Be forewarned, after you break a camp using Lament and have
spaced the spawns out, other people will arrive and demand
that you share with them. Normally I don't have a problem
with this, but lately Lower Guk seems to be crawling with
soloers who run in while you're resting and pick off the prize
mobs.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...

Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to toren@... with
the subject lol.
